remarks: The closed subspaces of a pre-Hilbert space are a Moore system.  Unlike many of our other examples of closure systems, this one is _not_ usually an algebraic closure system ~ df-acs : consider the Hilbert space of sequences ` NN --> RR ` with convergent sum; the subspace of all sequences with finite support is the classic example of a non-closed subspace, but for every finite set of sequences of finite support, there is a finite-dimensional (and hence closed) subspace containing all of the sequences, so if closed subspaces were an algebraic closure system this would violate ~ acsfiel .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Oct-2015.)
statement:
cssmre.v $e |- V = ( Base ` W ) $.
cssmre.c $e |- C = ( CSubSp ` W ) $.
cssmre $p |- ( W e. PreHil -> C e. ( Moore ` V ) ) $.
